name: Hostal Puerta del Sol

reviews.title: No Go!
reviews.text: Up a creekly open elevator to a dark hall, though a double locked door, down a non-descript hall and into a room which at first glance seemed okay. The surprises were yet to come.

reviews.title: Simple good value accommodation still noisy!
reviews.text: First the bed was too short for an average American male. Second, one had to sit on the toilet sidesaddle because there was no leg room. Third...watch the shower. It floods the closet sized bathrrom and streams into the bedroom.

reviews.title: Contstruction Work in the Square Outside - Take Earplugs!
reviews.text: Expect no amenities. Even the complimentary breakfast is made up of some white bread, packaged pressed ham, a few cheeses and cofee that must be nuked. I never saw any other guests and no wonder. Judging from the number of keys visible at the front desk, I was the only chump staying there. I've done a lot of traveling throughout the world and have found the Y to be better in all cases.

reviews.title: Acceptable place to stay, nothing fancy
reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff, clean but basic rooms. If your room is on the square side of the building ("square view") you may find the building work outside noisy. Located on the fourth or fifth floor of the building, but there is a lift. Hostel is very centrally located for Metro, the main tourist sites and all kinds of night life. We struggled to find it at first - it is next to the "Pans" hamburger takeaway and an opticians at one end of Sol Square.

reviews.title: Far better than expected!! Very comfortable!!
reviews.text: Just to let everyone know that we found this place very central, clean, cheap and friendly etc but that currently they are doing construction work in the square outside the hostel. This looks like fairly long-term work ie through the summer. We did luckily take ear plugs as we had heard that Madrid never sleeps and this worked! However, if you are looking for a tranquil location this is not the place at the moment!

reviews.title: Quiet Hostel with Character
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Puerta Del Sol, but it was a little too quiet for me. I was there for 3 nights, Since it was a gay hostel, i was expecting to maybe meet other gay travelers. There are actually signs posted throughout the hostel to be quiet. The hostel was extremely clean. The location was ideal. I bought a 10-rides ticket for the metro and only used 4, i could walk everywhere i needed to go. If you are looking for a charming quiet place to sleep and don't mind giving up the luxuries of a hotel i would recommend this hostel to you. I had a private room with a shared bathroom and paid 30 euro a night.

description: In the centrer town, near museums, bars, palaces, clubs and discos. Hotel servide with hostel price.
